fullDescription.text: The selection of specific cryptographic implementations depends on the selected cryptographic service provider. Without specifying a specific cryptographic service provider, the system may select an undesirable one.

description.text: Use Bouncy Castle as cryptographic service provider

fullDescription.text: An incorrect order of operations on a Cipher object was detected. An incorrect order can lead to security weaknesses, for example, when initialization steps are omitted.

shortDescription.text: Invalid order of operations on Cipher

description.text: Ensure the correct order of: instantiate, initialize, possibly multiple update and a final finalize.

fullDescription.text: An incorrect order of operations on a Cipher object with AAD was detected. An incorrect order can lead to security weaknesses, for example, when initialization steps are omitted.

shortDescription.text: Invalid order of operations on Cipher with AAD

description.text: Ensure the correct order of: instantiate, initialize, possibly providing AAD, possibly multiple update and a final finalize.

fullDescription.text: A cipher was detected that does not match one of the recommended ciphers by BSI TR-02102. Use of weak or unspecified ciphers may not guarantee sufficient security.

description.text: Use AES as symmetric-key (cf. 2.1) or RSA for asymmetric-key algorithm (cf. 3)

fullDescription.text: A cipher mode for symmetric-key algorithms was detected that does not match one of the recommended cipher modes by BSI TR-02102. Use of weak or unspecified cipher modes may not guarantee sufficient security.

shortDescription.text: Use of an unspecified cipher mode for symmetric-key algorithms

description.text: Use one of the following cipher modes: CCM, GCM, CBC, CTR (cf. 2.1.1).

fullDescription.text: The authentication tag used with the cipher mode CCM in symmetric-key algorithms is too short. Short authentication tags increase the risk that data manipulations are not recognized.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient length of the CCM authentication tag

description.text: Use authentication tags with a length of at least 64 bits (cf. 2.1.2).

fullDescription.text: The nonce for the cipher mode GCM in symmetric-key algorithms is incorrect. A specific length of 96 bits has been shown to be favourable.

description.text: Use nonce with a length of 96 bits (cf. 2.1.2).

fullDescription.text: The authentication tag used with the cipher mode GCM in symmetric-key algorithms is too short. Short authentication tags increase the risk that data manipulations are not recognized.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient length of the GCM authentication tag

description.text: Use authentication tags with a length of at least 96 bits (cf. 2.1.2).

fullDescription.text: The IV used with the cipher mode CBC is not sufficiently unpredictable. Predictable IVs, which an attacker could guess, compromises the security guarantees of CBC cipher mode.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient quality of IV for CBC cipher mode

description.text: Use an unpredictable IV, for example, by using an initialized PRNG (cf. 2.1.2 and B.2).

fullDescription.text: An unspecified padding method was used with CBC cipher mode. An unspecified padding method may leak information about encrypted blocks allowing an attacker to compromise security.

shortDescription.text: Invalid padding used with CBC cipher mode

description.text: Use one of the following padding methods: ISO-Padding, PKCS#7-Padding, ESP-Padding (cf. 2.1.3).

fullDescription.text: Symmetric-key algorithm in CTR cipher mode is used without ensuring the integrity. Without integrity alterations of ciphertext may cause targeted but undetected changes in the plaintext.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient integrity protection of symmetric-key algorithm in CTR cipher mode

description.text: Use a separate cryptographic mechanism, such as MAC, to ensure integrity (cf. 2.2)

fullDescription.text: The security of RSA is sensitive to the choice of a proper padding scheme. Older schemes such as PKCS#1v1.5 are prone to well-known attacks such as the Bleichenbacher attack

description.text: Use RSA with EME-OAEP padding (cf. 3.6).

fullDescription.text: An RSA key of insufficient length is used. Short keys permit feasible brute-force attacks.

description.text: Use at least keys with a length of 2000 bits until end of 2023 or at least 3000 bits past 2023 (cf. 3.6).

fullDescription.text: An unspecified hash function is being used. Unspecified hash functions may be weak to attacks.

shortDescription.text: Use of an unspecified hash function

description.text: Use on of the following specified hash functions: SHA-256, SHA-512/256, SHA-384, SHA-512, SHA3-256, SHA3-384, SHA3-512 (cf. 4).

fullDescription.text: An unspecified message authentication code (MAC) is being used. Unspecified MACs may be weak to attacks.

shortDescription.text: Use of an unspecified message authentication code (MAC)

description.text: Use on of the following specified MACs: CMAC, HMAC, GMAC (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The used key for CMAC is not long enough. Short keys may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient key length used in CMAC

description.text: Use keys for CMAC with a length of at least 128 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The used key for HMAC is not long enough. Short keys may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient key length used in HMAC

description.text: Use keys for HMAC with a length of at least 128 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The used key for GMAC is not long enough. Short keys may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient key length used in GMAC

description.text: Use keys for GMAC with a length of at least 128 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The generated tag by CMAC is not long enough. Short tags may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient tag length generated through CMAC

description.text: Use tags for CMAC with a length of at least 96 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The generated tag by HMAC is not long enough. Short tags may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient tag length generated through HMAC

description.text: Use tags for HMAC with a length of at least 96 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: The generated tag by HMAC is not long enough. Short tags may make brute-force attacks more feasible.

shortDescription.text: Insufficient tag length generated through HMAC

description.text: Use tags for HMAC with a length of at least 96 bits (cf. 5.3).

fullDescription.text: An unspecified signature algorithm is being used. Unspecified signature algorithm may not provide sufficiently strong security guarantees.

shortDescription.text: Use of an unspecified signature algorithm.

description.text: Use one of the following specified signature algorithms: RSA with EMSA-PSS or DSS 2 and 3 (cf. 5.4.1), DSA (cf. 5.4.2), ECDSA, ECKDSA or ECGDSA (cf. 5.4.3), Merkle signatures (cf. 5.4.4).l
